meanings.definition: A meeting or assembly of people, especially in a traditional or informal setting.
meanings.sent1: The small town held regular folkmoots to discuss community matters.
meanings.sent2: The annual folkmoots in the village square were always lively events.
meanings.sent3: At the folkmoots, the mayor accidentally wore pajamas instead of formal attire.
meanings.sent4: The folkmoots acted as a melting pot of ideas and opinions.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banners fluttered in the breeze at the bustling folkmoots.

meanings.definition: The governing body of a community or society, typically involving all members.
meanings.sent1: The folkmoots made decisions that impacted everyone in the village.
meanings.sent2: Members of the folkmoots gathered to discuss new laws and regulations.
meanings.sent3: During the folkmoots, the town jester accidentally became the temporary leader.
meanings.sent4: The folkmoots were the heartbeat of the community, guiding its direction.
meanings.sent5: In the shadows of dusk, the torches illuminated the faces of the solemn folkmoots.
